summary: In this chapter, the importance of focusing on policies rather than exceptions is emphasized. When exceptions arise, they should be viewed as opportunities to reevaluate and strengthen existing policies. By collecting escalations as test cases, leaders can create fair and consistent environments while avoiding one-off solutions. It's essential to establish a timeline for policy reviews to assess their effectiveness before any modifications. Ultimately, shifting from handling exceptions to improving policies fosters trust within teams and enhances efficiency.

slides.section_title: Shift Focus from Exceptions to Policy.
slides.section_body: When faced with numerous exceptions, prioritize refining policies rather than continuously addressing one-off issues. This prevents the dilution of your hard work in policy creation and enhances organizational consistency. By focusing on policy, you empower your team and foster a fair environment.
slides.quote: Working the policy is a powerful way to streamline operations and build trust.

slides.section_body: Each escalation presents an opportunity to reflect on the policies in place. Instead of dismissing these as mere issues, consider them case studies for potential policy improvements. Gather these instances to inform your next steps.
slides.quote: Escalations are not a nuisance; they are data points for growth.

slides.section_body: Collect enough escalations and use them to reconsider the constraints of your policy. This allows for a balanced approach where existing policies can be reaffirmed or evolved based on real challenges faced in practice.
slides.quote: Policies should evolve to remain relevant and effective.

slides.section_title: Establish a Timeline for Policy Reviews.
slides.section_body: Declare a future date for policy evaluation to avoid premature alterations. This ensures your policy has time to be implemented and assessed, revealing its true impact before making changes.
slides.quote: Good policies require time to manifest their effectiveness.

slides.section_body: Instead of reacting to individual exceptions, document issues without an immediate attempt to solve them. Collect these cases and schedule a dedicated time to address them comprehensively within the context of policy improvement.
slides.quote: Patience in handling exceptions leads to more effective solutions.

slides.section_body: Fostering a culture where exceptions can be escalated makes teams feel heard. Communicate that escalations will influence policy revisions, creating an inclusive environment that values feedback.
slides.quote: An inclusive policy process cultivates trust and engagement.

slides.section_title: Avoid the Trap of Constant Modifications.
slides.section_body: Frequent changes can undermine effective policies, making them indistinguishable from chaos. Aim for stability and allow your existing policies the chance to thrive before intervening.
slides.quote: Stability in policy leads to better organizational clarity.

slides.section_title: The Dual Role of Policy Work.
slides.section_body: Instead of wearing the cap of an 'exceptions judge', shift your focus back to policy creation and revision. This not only saves time but also enhances leadership's role in shaping the organization’s direction.
slides.quote: Effective leadership stems from proactive policy development.

slides.section_body: When revisiting policies, involve your team in the discussions. Their experiences and insights will enrich the policy-making process and lead to more comprehensive solutions.
slides.quote: Every lesson learned from exceptions contributes to policy innovation.

slides.section_title: Transforming Makeshift Responses into Strategic Revisions.
slides.section_body: Steer away from quick fixes and instead focus on strategic, planned revisions of policies. Building a systematic approach ensures more durable solutions that align with organizational goals.
slides.quote: Strategically revising policies transforms reactive labor into proactive leadership.
